meanings.definition: The act of applying too much fertilizer to plants.
meanings.sent1: Overfertilization can harm plants by giving them too many nutrients.
meanings.sent2: Farmers must be careful to avoid overfertilization when tending to their crops.
meanings.sent3: The garden suffered from overfertilization, resulting in vegetables growing as tall as trees!
meanings.sent4: The soil groaned under the weight of overfertilization, suffocating the delicate roots.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overfertilization were evident in the wilting leaves and stunted growth of the flowers.

meanings.definition: The state of having an excess of nutrients in the soil due to excessive fertilization.
meanings.sent1: Overfertilization can lead to an imbalance in the soil's nutrient levels.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners should test the soil regularly to prevent overfertilization.
meanings.sent3: The backyard turned into a jungle due to overfertilization, with plants growing wildly out of control.
meanings.sent4: The field resembled a buffet table after overfertilization, with plants feasting on an abundance of nutrients.
meanings.sent5: The once fertile land became barren wasteland after years of overfertilization, devoid of life.
